document.title: How to activate Windows all versions for free
document.summary: Use the tools on GitHub to activate Windows for free!

body.raw:
## Download Tool

<Callout icon='ðŸ”—' type='info'>
  [Download CMWTAT
  Digital](https://github.com/TGSAN/CMWTAT_Digital_Edition/releases)
</Callout>

1. Click `CMWTAT_Digital_Release_2_5_0_0.exe` to download the tool.

![Download CMWTAT Digital](</static/images/blog/how-to-activate-windows-all-versions-for-free/step(1).png>)

2. After opening the tool, select your Windows version, here I am in the Professional version, so select `Professional`.
3. Click `Activate`

![Use CMWTAT Digital](</static/images/blog/how-to-activate-windows-all-versions-for-free/step(2-3).png>)

Wait a moment

![Remove old key](</static/images/blog/how-to-activate-windows-all-versions-for-free/activating(1).png>)

![Obtain permission](</static/images/blog/how-to-activate-windows-all-versions-for-free/activating(2).png>)

![Activating](</static/images/blog/how-to-activate-windows-all-versions-for-free/activating(3).png>)

Activate successfully

![Activated](</static/images/blog/how-to-activate-windows-all-versions-for-free/activating(4).png>)

## To check activation

Go to the Windows Settings activation page and you will see Windows is activated.

![Activated](/static/images/blog/how-to-activate-windows-all-versions-for-free/activated.png)

document.title: How to Hack Wordle
document.summary: Want to get correct answer in Wordle? Click in!

body.raw:
## How?

Open **DevTools** in your browser (use <Kbd>F12</Kbd> or <Kbd>CTRL + Shift + i</Kbd>)ï¼ŒGo **`Application > Local Storage > https://www.nytimes.com > nyt-wordle-state`**

![Local storage](/static/images/blog/how-to-hack-wordle/step-1.png)

The answer can be found easily below

![Answer](/static/images/blog/how-to-hack-wordle/step-2.png)

document.title: How to Install and Activate VMware Workstation 16 Pro
document.summary: Install a different system with VMware and experience it!

body.raw:
## Step 1 - Download VMware 16 Pro

<Callout icon='ðŸ”—' type='info'>
  [Download VMware Workstation 16
  Pro](https://www.vmware.com/products/workstation-pro/workstation-pro-evaluation.html)
</Callout>

Download the appropriate version according to your system

![Download Workstation 16 Pro](</static/images/blog/how-to-install-and-activate-vmware-16/step-1(1).png>)

## Step 2 - Install VMware 16 Pro

1. Click Next

![Step 1](</static/images/blog/how-to-install-and-activate-vmware-16/step-2(1).png>)

2. Accept Terms
3. Click Next

![Step 2-3](</static/images/blog/how-to-install-and-activate-vmware-16/step-2(2-3).png>)

4. To enable enhanced keyboard support, please check Enhanced Keyboard Driver
5. Check Add VMware Workstation console tools into system PATH
6. Click Next

![Step 4-6](</static/images/blog/how-to-install-and-activate-vmware-16/step-2(4-6).png>)

Please check the box according to your needs

1. Click Next

![Step 7](</static/images/blog/how-to-install-and-activate-vmware-16/step-2(7).png>)

8. Click Next

![Step 8](</static/images/blog/how-to-install-and-activate-vmware-16/step-2(8).png>)

9. Click Install

![Step 9](</static/images/blog/how-to-install-and-activate-vmware-16/step-2(9).png>)

<Callout>Installation process, wait patiently</Callout>

![Installing](/static/images/blog/how-to-install-and-activate-vmware-16/installing.png)

1.  Click Finish

![Step 10](</static/images/blog/how-to-install-and-activate-vmware-16/step-2(10).png>)

This completes the installation of VMware Workstation Pro 16

## Step 3 - Activate VMware 16 Pro (optional)

Enter the License Key, select one of the following

```txt
ZF3R0-FHED2-M80TY-8QYGC-NPKYF
YF390-0HF8P-M81RQ-2DXQE-M2UT6
ZF71R-DMX85-08DQY-8YMNC-PPHV8
```

1. Click Continue

![Step 1-2](</static/images/blog/how-to-install-and-activate-vmware-16/step-3(1-2).png>)

3. Click Finish

![Step 3](</static/images/blog/how-to-install-and-activate-vmware-16/step-3(3).png>)

## Bonus - Set up Traditional Chinese

<Callout icon='ðŸ”—' type='info'>
  [Download Traditional Chinese Language
  Pack](/static/files/how-to-install-and-activate-vmware-16/zh_TW.zip)
</Callout>

1. Right-click VMware Workstation Pro 16 and click Open File Location

![Step 1](</static/images/blog/how-to-install-and-activate-vmware-16/step-4(1).png>)

2. Go to messages

![Step 2](</static/images/blog/how-to-install-and-activate-vmware-16/step-4(2).png>)

3. Unzip the `zh-TW.zip` you just downloaded, then copy / move it to `messages`.

![Step 3](</static/images/blog/how-to-install-and-activate-vmware-16/step-4(3).png>)

4. Right-click on VMware Workstation Pro 16 and click on Properties

![Step 4](</static/images/blog/how-to-install-and-activate-vmware-16/step-4(4).png>)

5. Add `--locale zh_TW` at the end of "Target"
6. Press OK

![Step 5-6](</static/images/blog/how-to-install-and-activate-vmware-16/step-4(5-6).png>)

After opening VMware again, the interface successfully switched to Traditional Chinese

![ä¸­æ–‡ä»‹é¢](/static/images/blog/how-to-install-and-activate-vmware-16/chinese.png)

document.title: How to Install Windows 11 on VMware
document.summary: Install Windows on VMware, and do something crazy!

body.raw:
## Install VMware

[Read Article - How to Install and Activate VMware Workstation 16 Pro](/blog/how-to-install-and-activate-vmware-16)

## Step 1 - Download Windows 11 ISO

<Callout icon='ðŸ”—' type='info'>
  [Download Windows 11
  ISO](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/software-download/windows11)
</Callout>

1. Select Windows 11 (multi-edition ISO)
2. Click Download
3. Select your language
4. Click Confirm

![](</static/images/blog/how-to-install-win11-on-vmware/step-1(1-4).png>)

5. Click 64-bit Download

![](</static/images/blog/how-to-install-win11-on-vmware/step-1(5).png>)

## Step 2 - Create Windows 11 Virtual Machine

1. Click Create a New Virtual Machine

![](</static/images/blog/how-to-install-win11-on-vmware/step-2(1).png>)

2. Select Typical
3. Next

![](</static/images/blog/how-to-install-win11-on-vmware/step-2(2-3).png>)

4. Select Installer disc image file (iso)
5. Click Browse to select the ISO that your download before
6. Next

![](</static/images/blog/how-to-install-win11-on-vmware/step-2(4-6).png>)

7. Select Microsoft Windows
8. Select Windows 10 x64 æˆ– Windows 10 and later x64 (If it has this option)
9. Next

![](</static/images/blog/how-to-install-win11-on-vmware/step-2(7-9).png>)

10. Type the Virtual machine name, here I named it Windows 11
11. Click Browse to select the virtual machine install location, here I select E drive
12. Next

![](</static/images/blog/how-to-install-win11-on-vmware/step-2(10-12).png>)

13. Type the Maximum disk size, recommended 60GB or more
14. Select Store virtual disk as a single file
15. Next

![](</static/images/blog/how-to-install-win11-on-vmware/step-2(13-15).png>)

16. Finish

![](</static/images/blog/how-to-install-win11-on-vmware/step-2(16).png>)

## Step 3 - Customize the virtual machine

1. Click Edit virtual machine settings

![](</static/images/blog/how-to-install-win11-on-vmware/step-3(1).png>)

2. Select Memory
3. Select 4 GB or more
4. OK

![](</static/images/blog/how-to-install-win11-on-vmware/step-3(2-4).png>)

5. Click Power on this virtual machine

![](</static/images/blog/how-to-install-win11-on-vmware/step-3(5).png>)

## Step 4 - Install Windows 11

1. Select your preferred language
2. Next

![](</static/images/blog/how-to-install-win11-on-vmware/step-4(1-2).png>)

3. Click Install now

![](</static/images/blog/how-to-install-win11-on-vmware/step-4(3).png>)

4. Select I donâ€™t have a product key or you may type your key

![](</static/images/blog/how-to-install-win11-on-vmware/step-4(4).png>)

5. Select the version that you want to install
6. Next

![](</static/images/blog/how-to-install-win11-on-vmware/step-4(5-6).png>)

<Callout>
  If the below situation does not appear, please skip to step 19.

Press <Kbd>Shift</Kbd> + <Kbd>F10</Kbd> to open CMD

</Callout>

![](/static/images/blog/how-to-install-win11-on-vmware/cant-install.png)

1. Type `regedit`

![](</static/images/blog/how-to-install-win11-on-vmware/step-4(7).png>)

8. Go to `Computer\HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\Setup`
9. Right click Setup
10. New > Key, and name it `LabConfig`

![](</static/images/blog/how-to-install-win11-on-vmware/step-4(8-10).png>)

11. New > DWORD (32-bit) Value

![](</static/images/blog/how-to-install-win11-on-vmware/step-4(11).png>)

12. Name it `BypassTPMCheck`
13. Value is 1
14. OK
15. Close the regedit (Registry Editor)

![](</static/images/blog/how-to-install-win11-on-vmware/step-4(12-15).png>)

16. Close the Windows Setup
17. Yes

![](</static/images/blog/how-to-install-win11-on-vmware/step-4(16-17).png>)

18. Install now

![](</static/images/blog/how-to-install-win11-on-vmware/step-4(18).png>)

19. Accept the Terms
20. Next

![](</static/images/blog/how-to-install-win11-on-vmware/step-4(19-20).png>)

21. Select Custom: Install Windows only (advanced)

![](</static/images/blog/how-to-install-win11-on-vmware/step-4(21).png>)

22. Select Drive 0
23. Next

![](</static/images/blog/how-to-install-win11-on-vmware/step-4(22-23).png>)

<Callout>Installing, please wait</Callout>

![](/static/images/blog/how-to-install-win11-on-vmware/installing.png)

<Callout icon='âœï¸'>
  Since initializing Windows 11 is easy, steps are skipped here
</Callout>

## Step 5 - Install VMware Tools (Optional)

1. Click VM
2. Click Install VMware Tools

![](</static/images/blog/how-to-install-win11-on-vmware/step-5(1-2).png>)

3. Open the file explorer
4. Select DVD Drive
5. Click setup.exe

![](</static/images/blog/how-to-install-win11-on-vmware/step-5(3-5).png>)

6. Yes

![](</static/images/blog/how-to-install-win11-on-vmware/step-5(6).png>)

7. Next

![](</static/images/blog/how-to-install-win11-on-vmware/step-5(7).png>)

8. Select Typical
9. Next

![](</static/images/blog/how-to-install-win11-on-vmware/step-5(8-9).png>)

10. Install

![](</static/images/blog/how-to-install-win11-on-vmware/step-5(10).png>)

After installing, you'll be able to use Windows 11 on full screen

![](/static/images/blog/how-to-install-win11-on-vmware/fullscreen.png)

document.title: PHP study notes
document.summary: Basics about PHP such as comments, Echo, variables, arithmetic operators

body.raw:
## Introduction of PHP PHP (full name: PHP: _Hypertext Preprocessor_) is an open source general-purpose computer scripting language, especially suitable for web development and embedded in HTML. The syntax of PHP draws on the characteristics of popular computer languages such as C language, Java and Perl, and is easy for general programmers to learn. The main goal of PHP is to allow web developers to quickly write dynamic pages, but PHP is also used in many other areas. The PHP file extension is `.php`, E.g `index.php`. As mentioned above, `PHP` can directly embed `HTML`. ## Usage When the browser reads ``. Such as: ```php showLineNumbers PHP ``` ## Precautions In `PHP`, there is no other `HTML` after the `PHP` directive is completed. It is recommended not to end with `?>`. It will cause trouble if it is closed. ```php showLineNumbers ``` ## Echo The simplest syntax in `PHP` is `Echo`. The content of `Echo` must be enclosed in double quotes `""` or single quotes `''`. Each syntax must end with a semicolon `;`. ```php showLineNumbers ``` Content in `Echo` can also use `HTML` syntax. For example, I used `
` here, so that the line can be broken. ```php showLineNumbers "; echo "This is the second sentence"; echo "here is a link"; ?> ``` ## Variable We can assign a value to a variable to make it easier for us to write `PHP`, similar to `Javascript`. We will use the Dollar sign `$`. ```php showLineNumbers ``` There are some rules to follow when we name variables. | Example | Description | Rules | | -------- | ----------------- | ----- | | $value | Lowercase | âœ… | | $Value | Uppercase | âœ… | | $\_value | Underscore | âœ… | | $1value | Start from number | âŒ | There is a difference between `uppercase` and `lowercase` in variable names. Uppercase variables are not equal to lowercase variables. ## Variable Naming Tips ### Camel case When a variable name and a function name are linked together by two or more words to form a unique identification word, the use of "camel case" to represent, can increase the readability of variables and functions. Because we can't have `spaces` in variables. ```php showLineNumbers ``` ### Snake case Snake case (like snake_case) refers to a writing style in which every space is replaced with an underscore ( \_ ) character and the first letter of every word is written in lowercase. ```php showLineNumbers ``` ## String operator There are two string operators. The first is the concatenation operator ("."), which returns the concatenated string of its left and right arguments. The second is the concatenation assignment operator (".="), which appends the right-hand argument to the left-hand argument. ```php showLineNumbers ``` ## Arithmetic operator ```php showLineNumbers ``` ## References - [PHP - Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PHP) - [Camel case - Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Camel_case) - [Snake case - Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Snake_case) - [String Operators](https://www.php.net/manual/en/language.operators.string.php)

body.raw:
I'm a full-stack web development student in **Hong Kong**. I'm 16 years old now. I'm currently learning TypeScript, Next.js, React.js, Node.js, and database management.

I started learning web development on December 5, 2022 (14 yrs). It's a big challenge for me because it's just one of my hobbies and I haven't taken any courses. I am self-learning on YouTube. One of my favorite YouTube channels is [The Net Ninja](https://www.youtube.com/@NetNinja). I learned a lot of web development skills from him.

I love using [Next.js](https://nextjs.org/) to create a website. Then use [GitHub](https://github.com) to host my codebase. Finally, I use [Vercel](https://vercel.com) to deploy my website.

## About this site

- Framework: [Next.js](https://nextjs.org/)
- Database: [Planetscale](https://planetscale.com/)
- ORM: [Prisma](https://prisma.io/)
- Authentication: [NextAuth.js](https://next-auth.js.org/)
- Deployment: [Vercel](https://vercel.com)
- Comment: [Giscus](https://giscus.app/)
- Favicon: [realfavicongenerator](https://realfavicongenerator.net/)
- Content: [MDX](https://mdxjs.com/) + [Contentlayer](https://www.contentlayer.dev/)
- Analytics: [Vercel](https://vercel.com/)
- Styling: [Tailwindcss](https://tailwindcss.com)
- Code syntax highlighting: [Shiki](https://github.com/shikijs/shiki)

Thanks to **Timothy Lin** for the
[tailwind-nextjs-starter-blog](https://github.com/timlrx/tailwind-nextjs-starter-blog). It helped me when I haven't any idea how to create a blog from scratch. My code isn't like the starter code because I changed a lot of code :)

## Inspiration

Here are some websites that inspired me a lot to build a fantastic website.

- [leerob.io](https://leerob.io/)
- [nextra](https://nextra.site/)
- [theodorusclarence.com](https://theodorusclarence.com/)
- [ped.ro](https://ped.ro/)
- [delba.dev](https://delba.dev/)
- [joshwcomeau.com](https://www.joshwcomeau.com/)
- [blog.maximeheckel.com](https://blog.maximeheckel.com/)
- [zenorocha.com](https://zenorocha.com/)
- [jahir.dev](https://jahir.dev/)
- [anishde.dev](https://anishde.dev/)
- [nikolovlazar.com](https://nikolovlazar.com/)
- [samuelkraft.com](https://samuelkraft.com/)

## Links

- [Instagram](https://instagram.com/tszhong0411)
- [YouTube](https://youtube.com/@tszhong0411)
- [GitHub](https://github.com/tszhong0411)

body.raw:
My personal website and blog.

I see a lot of websites on the Internet. Blog, I want to create my own blog where I can write whatever I want. Regardless of the tutorial, notes, or journal. Therefore, I started learning web development skills on December 5, 2020. First, I learned HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. After a year, I found that a static website was not enough for me. And I started learning React.js, then Next.js.

[See more](/about)

document.name: Friend quiz cheat tool
document.description: Get full score in friend quiz

body.raw:
I often see a link to a friend quiz from a friend on Instagram, and I wonder if I can hack it, and something interesting happens when I press `F12`.

## Tech Stack

- Icons: [Tabler icons](https://tabler-icons.io/)
- UI: [Mantine](https://mantine.dev)
- Internationalization: [next-translate](https://github.com/aralroca/next-translate)
- HTML parser: [JSDOM](https://github.com/jsdom/jsdom)

body.raw:
I saw a lot of people using [Linktree](https://linktr.ee/) so I had an idea if I could build one myself. I put a lot of social media links on one page.

And so this website was born!

## Tech Stack

- Framework: [Next.js](https://nextjs.org/)
- Deployment: [Vercel](https://vercel.com)
- Favicon: [realfavicongenerator](https://realfavicongenerator.net/)
- Analytics: [Vercel](https://vercel.com/)
- Styling: [Tailwindcss](https://tailwindcss.com)
- Icon: [react-icons](https://react-icons.github.io/react-icons/)
- Animation: [Framer Motion](https://www.framer.com/motion/)

document.name: One Blog
document.description: A simple blog made by å°åº·

body.raw:
I tried to make an online blog where users could write their own posts with a rich text editor. It's a big challenge because I'm not familiar with databases. I'm using Prisma to connect to the database. I refer to many projects when I build this website such as [prisma/fullstack-prisma-nextjs-blog](https://github.com/prisma/fullstack-prisma-nextjs-blog).

## Tech Stack

- Database: [Supabase](https://supabase.com/)
- ORM: [Prisma](https://www.prisma.io/)
- Rich text editor: [Tiptap](https://tiptap.dev)
- Authentication: [NextAuth](https://next-auth.js.org)
- Icon: [Tabler icons](https://tabler-icons.io/)
- UI: [Mantine](https://mantine.dev)
- Code syntax highlighting: [Lowlight](https://github.com/wooorm/lowlight)

body.raw:
The project every web developer builds, Todo

## Tech Stack

- Framework: [Next.js](https://nextjs.org/)
- Database: [Supabase](https://supabase.com/)
- ORM: [Prisma](https://prisma.io/)
- Authentication: [NextAuth.js](https://next-auth.js.org/)
- Deployment: [Vercel](https://vercel.com)
- Favicon: [realfavicongenerator](https://realfavicongenerator.net/)
- Analytics: [Vercel](https://vercel.com/)
- Styling: [Tailwindcss](https://tailwindcss.com)

body.raw:
I made some useful tools and hosted them on [tools.honghong.me](https://tools.honghong.me) I want to practice my programming skills. Learning different techniques by making different tools, such as making and view PDF is not easy, and color is also a science

Hope the tools I made help you!

## Tech Stack

- Icon: [Tabler icons](https://tabler-icons.io/)
- UI: [Mantine](https://mantine.dev)
- Code editor: [@monaco-editor/react](https://github.com/suren-atoyan/monaco-react)
- Color analysis and conversion: [Colord](https://github.com/omgovich/colord)
- PDF viewer: [@react-pdf-viewer/core](https://react-pdf-viewer.dev/)
